notesStmt.note: Signatures: 9I-9K2. Also issued as part of a through-paged set with a table for the entire set added.
On 9I2: last word of first line of text: "Abuses"; first word of line below initial: "All"; last word of last full line: "shall".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

projectDesc.p: Created by converting TCP files to TEI P5 using tcp2tei.xsl, TEI @ Oxford.

editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,368 texts created during Phase 1 of the project (2000-2009), initially available only to institutions that contributed to their creation, were released into the public domain on 1 January 2015. The approximately 40,000 texts produced during Phase 2 (2009- ), of which 34,963 had been released as of 2020, originally similarly restricted, were similarly freed from all restrictions on 1 August 2020. As of that date anyone is free to take and use these texts for any purpose (modify them, annotate them, distribute them, etc.). But we do respectfully request that due credit and attribution be given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).
Keying and markup guidelines are available at the Text Creation Partnership web site.

div.p: AN ACT FOR REGULATING The Making of STUFFS IN Norfolk and Norwich.
ORdered by the Parliament, That this Act be forthwith printed and publi≈øhed.
London, Printed by Edward Husband and John Field, Printers to the Parliament of England, 1650.

div.head: AN ACT FOR REGULATING The Making of STUFFS IN Norfolk and Norwich.
div.p:
WHereas divers Abu≈øes and Deceits have of late years been had and u≈øed in the Making of Wor≈øteds and other Stuffs, commonly called Norwich Stuffs, and in the Reeling of the Yarns whereof the ≈øaid Stuffs are either wholly or in part made; All which tends to the deba≈øing of the ≈øaid Manufacture, unto the prejudice of the Publique: For prevention of all which Abu≈øes and Deceits, It is Enacted by this pre≈øent Parliament, That from henceforth there be and ≈øhall be a Corporation within the ≈øaid City and County of Norwich and County of Norfolk; con≈øi≈øting of Two Pre≈øidents, Twelve Wardens, and Forty A≈ø≈øi≈øtants: All which are to be Ma≈øter Weavers within the places afore≈øaid; and one of the ≈øaid Pre≈øidents, and Six of the ≈øaid Wardens, and Twenty of the ≈øaid A≈ø≈øi≈øtants, ≈øhall
be yearly Cho≈øen upon the la≈øt Wedne≈øday in the Moneth of November, at ≈øome publique place, by the Ma≈øter Weavers, or the greater part of them pre≈øent, of the ≈øaid City and County of Norwich; and the other of the ≈øaid Pre≈øidents, ≈øix Wardens, and Twenty A≈øsi≈øtants, ≈øhall be Cho≈øen on the ≈øame day in ≈øome publique place by the Ma≈øter Weavers, or the greater part of them pre≈øent, of the County of Norfolk: And the ≈øaid Twelve Wardens ≈øhall within Fourteen days after they ≈øhall be ≈øo Cho≈øen or Elected, take the Oath en≈øuing, to be admini≈øtred to them by the Mayor of Norwich for the time being or his Deputy, or any one Iu≈øtice of the Peace of the County of Norfolk for the time being, if he be pre≈øent, otherwi≈øe by the ≈øaid Mayor or his Deputy onely, which they have hereby power to admini≈øter accordingly; (viz.)

I A.B. do Swear, That I will well, faithfully and hone≈øtly perform and di≈øcharge the Office of a Warden of the Corporation of Wor≈øted-Weavers, according to the be≈øt of my skill, power and knowledge.

And be it further Enacted by the Authority afore≈øaid, That the ≈øaid Pre≈øidents, Wardens and A≈øsi≈øtants for the time being, ≈øhall for ever hereafter in Name and Fact be one Body Politique and Corporate in Law, to all intents and purpo≈øes, and ≈øhall have a perpetual Succe≈ø≈øion, and be called by the Name of the Pre≈øidents, Wardens and A≈øsi≈øtants of the Wor≈øted-Weavers of the City and County of Norwich and County of Norfolk; and ≈øue or plead, and be ≈øued or impleaded by the Name afore≈øaid, in all Courts and places of Iudicature within this Nation; and by that Name ≈øhall and may,
without Licen≈øe in Mortmain, purcha≈øe, take or receive any Lands, Tenements or Hereditaments of the Gift, Alienation or Demi≈øe of any per≈øon or per≈øons, who are hereby without further Licen≈øe enabled to transfer the ≈øame, and any Goods or Chattels what≈øoever, for the u≈øe and benefit of the Corporation afore≈øaid, not exceeding the yearly Value of One thou≈øand pounds. And for the Regulation and good Government of the ≈øaid Trade and Manufacture, The ≈øaid Corporation, or any Thirteen or more of them, whereof one Pre≈øident and Seven or more Wardens to be pre≈øent, ≈øhall have hereby Power and Authority from time to time to meet and keep Courts, for the ends in this Act mentioned, within the City of Norwich, at ≈øuch time and place as ≈øhall be appointed by the ≈øaid Pre≈øidents or one of them, and Wardens or the greater number of them for the time being, who are hereby Required upon the de≈øire of any Eight or more of the ≈øaid A≈øsi≈øtants at any time to warn and keep a Court accordingly; And the ≈øaid Corporation, or any Thirteen or more of them, whereof one Pre≈øident and Seven or more Wardens to be pre≈øent as afore≈øaid, or the greater number of them, ≈øhall have, and hereby have Power and Authority from time to time to make and appoint a Common Seal, or ≈øeveral Common Seals for the u≈øe of the ≈øaid Corporation, and to make By-Laws, Rules and Ordinances for and concerning the Regulation of the Premi≈øes, and of ≈øuch Particulars as ≈øhall be by them or the greater number of them, found requi≈øite for the better Regulation of the ≈øaid Trade and Manufacture, and the due Execution of this Act; which By-Laws, Rules and Ordinances being Confirmed and Ratified by the
Mayor and one Iu≈øtice of the Peace for the time being of the ≈øaid City and County of Norwich, and two other Iu≈øtices of the Peace of the ≈øaid County of Norfolk, or the greater number of them, ≈øhall be obeyed and kept by the ≈øeveral per≈øons within or under the Government of the ≈øaid Corporation or Regulation. And for the better Regulation and carrying on of the work afore≈øaid, and avoiding of all Frauds and Deceits therein, Be it further Enacted by the Authority afore≈øaid, That all Yarns called Wor≈øted-Yarns, or u≈øed by the Wor≈øted-Weavers, ≈øhall be made without fraud, and ≈øhall before the ≈øame be put or offered to ≈øale, be Reeled on a Reel of a full Yard about, every Reel-≈øtaff containing Fourteen Leas, and every Lea containing Forty thrids, Twelve of tho≈øe Reel-≈øtaves making a Dozen, and Twelve of tho≈øe Dozens making a Gro≈øs; And in ca≈øe any per≈øon or per≈øons ≈øhall after the Tenth of October, One thou≈øand ≈øix hundred and fifty, offer to put to ≈øale any the Yarns afore≈øaid within the City of Norwich and County of Norfolk, made and Reeled in any other maner then as afore≈øaid, That then it ≈øhall and may be lawful to and for the Pre≈øidents, Wardens and A≈øsi≈øtants afore≈øaid, or any two or more of them, to ≈øeize, take and carry away all ≈øuch Yarn as is defective and fal≈øe as above≈øaid; The ≈øame to be within Eight days after ≈øuch Seizure brought into the Common-Hall of the Corporation afore≈øaid, and within Twenty days after ≈øuch Seizure, to be brought to a Tryal by a Iury of Twelve hone≈øt and able Artificers of the ≈øame Regulation, whereof Six to be of the City and County of Norwich, and other Six of the County of Norfolk: Which Twelve Artificers the Mayor of the City of
Norwich, or his Deputy, for the time being, are hereby authorized to Summon and Warn to appear at the Guildhall of the ≈øaid City, at time certain by him to be appointed, and to be Impannelled, and Sworn to enquire of the defects of the ≈øaid Yarn, contrary to this pre≈øent Act: Which Oath the ≈øaid Mayor or his Deputy are hereby authorized to give. And for ≈øuch and ≈øo much Yarn afore≈øaid as ≈øhall be ≈øo found, and pre≈øented by the ≈øaid Iury to be defective, the ≈øaid Iury ≈øhall have, and hereby have power to ≈øet and impo≈øe ≈øuch Fine or Fines upon the Owners thereof, as in their di≈øcretion ≈øhall be thought meet, not exceeding the value of the moyety of ≈øuch defective Yarns; which ≈øaid Fines the Owners of the ≈øaid re≈øpective Yarns ≈øhall pay unto the Wardens of the ≈øaid Corporation, or one of them, to and for the u≈øe of the Poor of the ≈øaid Corporation, within Forty days after the ≈øame Fine ≈øhall be ≈øo ≈øet; or in default thereof, the ≈øaid Wardens ≈øhall put to ≈øale the ≈øaid Yarns, rendring the Overplus to be rai≈øed by ≈øale thereof, unto the ≈øaid Owners upon demand. And it is hereby further Enacted and Ordained, That if the ≈øaid Yarn ≈øhall not be pre≈øented, and found by a Iury of Twelve men as afore≈øaid, to be defective as afore≈øaid, ≈øo as the ≈øame ≈øhall appear to be ≈øeized without ju≈øt cau≈øe as afore≈øaid, That then he or they that ≈øhall ≈øo ≈øeize the ≈øame, ≈øhall forfeit to the Owner or Owners of the Yarn ≈øo ≈øeized, the treble value of the Yarn ≈øo ≈øeized, and three times ≈øo much Damages as he or they ≈øhall and may ≈øu≈øtain by ≈øuch Seizure, or by means or rea≈øon thereof; The ≈øame to be adjudged and taxed by the Mayor of the ≈øaid City of Norwich for the time being, and be levyed by ≈øale of the Offenders Goods,
by Warrant under the Hand and Seal of the Mayor of the City of Norwich for the time being, if ≈øuch Seizure ≈øhall be made within the ≈øaid City of Norwich or County of the ≈øame; And if ≈øuch Seizure ≈øhall be made within the County of Norfolk, The ≈øame to be adjudged and taxed by any one or more Iu≈øtices of the Peace within the ≈øaid County of Norfolk, and to be levyed by Warrant under the Hand and Seal of any one or more ≈øuch Iu≈øtice or Iu≈øtices of the Peace of the ≈øaid County of Norfolk. And it is hereby further Enacted, That all ≈øorts of Stuffs, whether wooven of Wooll onely, or of Wooll and other Materials within the City and County of Norwich, and County of Norfolk, or either of them, ≈øhall be under the Power, Government and Regulation of the ≈øaid Corporation, in ≈øuch maner as by this and other Acts of Parliament, and the By-Laws made and to be made by vertue hereof, are or ≈øhall be E≈øtabli≈øhed (except ≈øuch Stuffs as are under the Regulation of the Wardens, and Fellow≈øhip of the My≈øtery of Ru≈ø≈øel Sattins, Sattins Rever≈øes, and Fu≈øtian of Norwich making, within the ≈øaid City of Norwich) And that all Stuffs made or to be made under the Regulation afore≈øaid, before the ≈øame ≈øhall be offered or put to ≈øale, ≈øhall be brought to ≈øome convenient place or places within the ≈øaid County of the City of Norwich, and County of Norfolk, to be appointed by the ≈øaid Wardens, or the more part of them, to be viewed and ≈øearched by the ≈øaid Wardens or any two of them; and if the ≈øame ≈øhall be found to be well and ≈øufficiently made and wrought, according to the Rules and Ordinances of the ≈øaid Corporation for the time being, Then all ≈øuch Stuffs ≈øhall be by the ≈øaid Wardens or any two of them, ≈øealed and allowed
accordingly, without any Sum of Moneys paid or to be paid for the ≈øame: And if upon ≈øearch or view thereof, any ≈øuch Stuffs ≈øhall be found, and appear to be defective, contrary to the Rules and Ordinances of the ≈øaid Corporation, Then ≈øuch defective Stuffs ≈øhall be ≈øeized by the ≈øaid Wardens, or any two of them; And ≈øhall be from time to time ordered and brought to Tryal, proceeded on and Fined in ≈øuch maner and form as is in this pre≈øent Act before limited and appointed for the defective Yarns afore≈øaid: And if any per≈øon ≈øhall buy or ≈øell any piece of Stuff made under the Regulation of this Corporation un≈øealed, and being thereof convicted by his own Confe≈øsion, or the Oathes of two or more Witne≈ø≈øes, before the Mayor of the ≈øaid City of Norwich, or his Deputy, for the time being, or before any Iu≈øtice of the Peace for the time being for the County of Norfolk, who have hereby power to admini≈øter an Oath for that purpo≈øe, the ≈øaid per≈øon, if he be a Buyer, ≈øhall forfeit for every piece of Stuff ≈øo brought un≈øealed, Four ≈øhillings; and if a Seller, for every piece ≈øo ≈øold, ≈øhall forfeit other Four ≈øhillings, to the u≈øe of the Corporation afore≈øaid: And if any per≈øon counterfeit any Seal of the ≈øaid Wardens, or Seal any piece of Stuff with any Seal as ≈øhall be counterfeited, Every per≈øon ≈øo offending, and being thereof convicted as afore≈øaid, ≈øhall forfeit the Sum of Twenty pounds, to and for the u≈øe of the Poor of the ≈øaid Corporation: which ≈øaid Penalties and Forfeitures re≈øpectively, ≈øhall be levyed by ≈øale of the Goods and Chattels of the Offender or Offenders, by warrant to be granted from the ≈øaid Mayor or Iu≈øtice of Peace re≈øpectively, before whom ≈øuch Conviction ≈øhall be; and for default of Goods and Chattels
whereon to levy the ≈øaid Forfeiture of Twenty pounds, the party ≈øo offending ≈øhall ≈øuffer Six Moneths Impri≈øonment, without Bail or Mainprize. And the ≈øaid Pre≈øidents, Wardens and A≈ø≈øi≈øtants, or any two or more of them, ≈øhall have, and hereby have power to enter into the Hou≈øe and Work-hou≈øe of any Artificer within the ≈øaid City of Norwich and County of Norfolk, under the Regulation of the ≈øaid Corporation, at all times of the day, and u≈øual times of working and opening of Shops; and into the Shops, Hou≈øes and Ware-hou≈øes of any Merchant, Common Buyer, Dealer in, and Retailer of any the ≈øaid Stuffs; and into the Hou≈øes or Work-hou≈øes of any Dyer, Sheerman, Calender, and all other Workmens hou≈øes and places of ≈øale or dre≈øsing of the ≈øaid Stuffs, or ≈øelling of Yarns, and may there ≈øearch and view the Yarn and Stuffs re≈øpectively, whether they be ordered and made according to the Laws, Orders and Ordinances of the ≈øaid Trade: And if any Stuff or Materials afore≈øaid ≈øhall be found faulty or defective, to ≈øeize, take and carry away the ≈øame, to be ordered, brought to Tryal, and proceeded in maner and form as is before in this Act mentioned and appointed for defective Yarns and Stuffs. And all Mayors, Iu≈øtices, Sheriffs, Bayliffs, Con≈øtables and Officers, ≈øhall be ayding and a≈øsi≈øting to the ≈øaid Pre≈øidents, Wardens and A≈øsi≈øtants, or any of them, as often as they ≈øhall be thereunto required: And in all Actions or Suits that ≈øhall be brought again≈øt any per≈øon or per≈øons, for any acting according to the true intent and meaning of this Act, That ≈øuch per≈øon or per≈øons ≈øhall or may plead the General I≈ø≈øue of Not-guilty, and give the ≈øpecial Matter in Evidence; And ≈øhall recover
double Co≈øts, if the Verdict pa≈øs for him and them, or that the Plaintiff or Plaintiffs be Non≈øuited. Provided always, That this Act, nor any thing therein contained, ≈øhall not be prejudicial or hurtful to the Weavers of the Towns of Great-Yarmouth and Lyn in the ≈øaid County of Norfolk, or either of them, to deprive them or either of them of ≈øuch Liberties or Priviledges as are granted unto them by an Act of Parliament made in the Fourteenth year of the Reign of King Henry the Eighth, or by any other Act of Parliament what≈øoever. Provided, That this Act ≈øhall continue for the ≈øpace of Three years from the Fir≈øt of November, One thou≈øand ≈øix hundred and fifty, and no longer.
ORdered by the Parliament, That this Act be forthwith printed and publi≈øhed.
